newsitem.title: GUYANA: Guyanese police search for stolen light aircraft.
newsitem.headline: Guyanese police search for stolen light aircraft.

text.p: Guyanese police and army searched Thursday for an eight-seater light aircraft hijacked and stolen at gunpoint over Guyana's western jungle.

The Roraima Airways aircraft was held up by four passengers shortly after take-off from the tiny logging community Kwebanna, about 80 miles (130 km) northwest of the capital Georgetown, owner Gerry Gouveia told Reuters.
The Spanish-speaking gang forced the plane to return to Kwebanna, dropped off the pilot, co-pilot and one passenger, loaded extra fuel and took off, pilot Chris Rowe told reporters.
Police said air traffic controllers in Venezuela and nearby Caribbean islands had been asked to keep a lookout for the plane.
